results.title: The MutleyMedia Booth
results.brief_description: Provides a descriptive run-down of the machinations of the ACMI MutleyMedia Booth through a presentation taken from a walk through that will play on the Booth’s three screens. Two short films - Pneumatic and Chinagirl - embedded in the presentation represent the 16 original works by Australian artists made for screening inside the Booth.

results.title: The Musicians in the woods
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Animated puppets enact the Grimm fairy tale about the forsaken animals who set out to make their way in the world. The adventures in which the donkey, cat, dog, and rooster outwit a band of htieves and gain a fortune is told here in colorful and amusing fashion.

results.title: The Musical ride
results.brief_description: A 1955 film presentation of the famous Musical Ride of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. In a display of brilliant horsemanship, scarlet-coated Mounties take their horses through the many intricate patterns of the Ride, performed to the accompaniment of band music.

results.title: The Music theatre = children's music theatre
results.creator_credit: Terry Byan and Television One (New Zealand)
results.brief_description: Four children’s musical favourites make up this colourful series which features the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and some of New Zealand’s leading actors and dancers. “Tubby the tuba” tells the story of a tuba who is the ugly duckling of the orchestra. “The Sorcerer’s apprentice” Bored with the daily chores, an apprentice sorcerer seizes the opportunity to apply sorcery to his housework and ends up in trouble. “Peter and the wolf” Prokofiev’s musical introduction to the orchestra tells of Peter and his first encounter with a wolf. “Carnival of the animals” Imaginatively costumed animal characters saunter and cavort in a visually exciting production of the well loved music of Saint-Saens.

results.title: The Music teacher = Le Maitre de musique
results.creator_credit: Jacqueline Pierreux, Belgian Television, K2-One and Gerard Corbiau
results.brief_description: A poignant love story, a pulse-pounding international music competition, and music of timeless beauty is featured in this enthralling tale of talent and romance. Shortly before the Great War, celebrated singer Joachim Dallaryc (played by real-life opera star Jose Van Dam) suddenly announces his retirement from the stage, leaving the opera world stunned. Only the fabulously wealthy and diabolical Prince Scotti, his lifelong rival, gloats. Dallaryc retreats to the country devoting himself to training two young singers, the beautiful Sophie, who falls in love with him, and Jean, a retired thief who falls in love with Sophie. Their unrelenting and rigorous apprenticeship ends when Sophie and Jean are invited to an international singing competition staged by Prince Scotti. It will lead to either fame and riches - or to Prince Scotti’s revenge for his defeat by their teacher in a singing competition two decades before.

results.title: The Music school
results.creator_credit: Dan McCann, John Korty and Learning in Focus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of John Updike’s short story written in 1964 in which a middle aged writer attempts to find some meaning for his life. Narrated by Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: The Music of Mozart and Haydn
results.creator_credit: Lexi Godfrey, Dave Heather, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the magnificent Haydnsaal of the Schloss Esterhazy in Eisenstadt, Austria and in the historic palaces of Vienna, the Polish Chamber Orchestra conducted by Jerzy Maksymiuk perform three beautiful pieces of chamber music by two of Austria’s greatest classical composers, Mozart and Haydn. Includes images of some of Austria’s picturesque landscapes, artworks and amazing palaces and gardens creating an ambient background to the music of the Orchestra. No commentary.

results.title: The Music of Giuseppe Verdi
results.creator_credit: United Films and United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description: This film shows Toscanini conducting pieces by Verdi and also focuses on his and other Italians efforts to fight fascism in Europe by living and working as exiles in America. Music includes La Forza del Oestino and Hymn of the Nations, the second piece being the one Toscanini chose to play on the day Italy was liberated from the fascists. Features Arturo Toscanini as conductor, the NBC Symphony Orchestra, Jan Peerce (tenor) and the Westminster Choir.

results.title: The Music of Erich Zann
results.creator_credit: Essential Saltes Productions, John Strysik and Robert Rothman
results.brief_description: Set in late nineteenth century Paris, the film follows the efforts of Charles Dexter Ward, a young American student, to make the acquaintance of an ageing musician who lives a secluded life in the room above him at a boarding house. Ward is fascinated, then driven to unravel the mysterious circumstances surrounding Zann and his music: he wants to learn why Zann plays wondrous, often awesomely compelling music late at night. Based on a short story by H.P. Lovecraft.

results.title: The Music of a modern navy
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: In a fast moving “cinema verite” style film the bands of the Royal Australian Navy play jazz, pops, country and western, Latin American and martial music. In changing locales, such as Kings Cross, Australia Square, the Royal Brisbane Show, in New South Wales country towns, on board ship and in Naval establishments they perform and entertain.
